intro: Microchilus integer, commonly known as the smooth-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes. Microchilus integer is often found in alpine or arctic regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
